definition[0]: the young men who were killed in World War I, who could have been successful in art, science, literature etc
definition[1]: all the people who became adults during or just after World War I, and who suffered great social and emotional disadvantages as a result
definition[2]: a group of US writers who grew up during World War I, such as Ernest Hemingway and F. Scott Fitzgerald, and who went to live in Paris in the 1920s
